Package net.sf.jstuff.core.concurrent

Class CircuitBreaker

java.lang.Object
net.sf.jstuff.core.concurrent.CircuitBreaker
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListenable<CircuitBreaker.State>
public class CircuitBreaker extends Object implements EventListenable<CircuitBreaker.State>
See:
  • http://martinfowler.com/bliki/CircuitBreaker.html
  • http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka/current/common/circuitbreaker.html
  • https://docs.wso2.com/display/MSF4J200/Implementing+a+Circuit+Breaker

Example: 

 CircuitBreaker cb = CircuitBreaker.builder() //
    .name("ldap-access") //
    .failureThreshold(3) //
    .failureTrackingPeriod(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS) //
    .resetPeriod(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS) //
    .hardTrippingExceptionTypes(java.net.UnknownHostException.class) //
    .maxConcurrent(20) //
    .build();

 // OPTION 1:
 if (cb.tryAcquire()) {
    try {
       // query LDAP here

       cb.reportSuccess();
    } catch (Exception ex) {
       cb.reportError(ex);
    } finally {
       cb.release(); // IMPORTANT: always release after acquire was successful
    }
 } else
    throw new IllegalStateException("LDAP service is not available");

 // OPTION 2:
 Runnable ldapQuery = new Runnable() {
    public void run() {
       // query LDAP here
    }
 };
 if (!cb.tryExecute(ldapQuery))
    throw new IllegalStateException("LDAP service is not available");
Author:
Sebastian Thomschke

    • tryAcquire

      public boolean tryAcquire()
      Acquires 1 permit. IMPORTANT: Do not forget to call the release() when done.
      Returns:
      false if no permit was issued.

    • tryExecute

      public boolean tryExecute(Callable<?> callable) throws Exception
      Tries to execute the given runnable after acquiring a permit.
      Returns:
      true if the code was executed. false if the code was not executed because no permit could be acquired.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • tryExecute

      public boolean tryExecute(Callable<?> callable, int errorTimeout, TimeUnit timeUnit) throws Exception
      Tries to execute the given runnable after acquiring a permit.
      Parameters:
      errorTimeout - if the execution of the code takes longer than errorTimeout and error is reported
      Returns:
      true if the code was executed. false if the code was not executed because no permit could be acquired.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • tryExecute

      public <A, E extends Exception> boolean tryExecute(Invocable<?,A,E> invocable, A args) throws E
      Tries to execute the given invocable after acquiring a permit.
      Returns:
      true if the code was executed. false if the code was not executed because no permit could be acquired.
      Throws:
      E extends Exception
